channel.title: Carboline Tech Service Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Paul Atzemis, Jack Walker
channel.description: Carboline Technical Service Engineers Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss common industrial coatings and linings products, problems, solutions, and painting and testing techniques. They use their experiences in Technical Service, their history in the field, and the knowledge from their NACE Level 3 Peer certifications to help explain the industrial coating industry.

item.title: CTSP Episode 152 - Coating Technology Used in Wastewater Treatment Systems
item.description:
Carboline Wastewater Market Manager Brian Cheshire joins Paul Atzemis and Jack Walker to discuss coating technologies used in wastewater treatment systems. They discuss epoxy, polyurethane, and polyurea coatings.

  • 0:00 – Intro
  • 2:00 – Brian Cheshire, Carboline Water/Wastewater Market Manager
  • 3:27 – WEFTEC Connect
  • 5:00 – Corrosion causes throughout wastewater systems
  • 5:38 – Coating technology used within a wastewater treatment system
  • 6:56 – Epoxy coatings used in wastewater treatment systems
  • 9:00 – Aromatic hybrid polyurethane coatings used in wastewater treatment systems
  • 11:09 – Polyurea coatings used in wastewater treatment systems
  • 13:58 – Carboline coatings that are good for wastewater treatment systems
  • 15:22 – Wrap up

Subscribe via iTunes, Google Play, or Spotify.

Find out more at https://carboline-tech-service-podcast.pinecast.co

item.description:

item.title: CTSP - Episode 150 - Choosing a Fireproofing Coating
item.description:
Carboline Technical Service Engineer Chris Burst joins the guys to discuss the process of making a passive fire protection product recommendation. They discuss the different types of passive fire protection coatings and when to use an intumescent or a cementitious product.

  • 13:52 – Wrap up

item.title: CTSP Episode 149 - New Technology for Fire Tubes on Upstream Oil and Gas Process Vessels
item.description:
Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss a brand new technology brought to you by Carboline, Supoxy based coatings. The duo discusses the latest technology while introducing the first product in the line: Plasite XHT 400, designed to coat fire tubes on upstream process vessels. Paul and Jack also explain how fire tubes work and why coating them is challenging.

  • 0:00 – Intro and second takes
  • 1:25 – The goal of the Carboline Tech Service Podacst
  • 2:16 – The new Supoxy technology and Plasite XHT 400
  • 3:30 – Fire tubes in upstream oil and gas process vessels
  • 4:50 – Phase separation within upstream oil and gas process vessels
  • 6:15 – Gas phase within the upstream oil and gas process vessels
  • 7:02 – Steam coil heating versus fire tube heating
  • 8:33 – The development of Plasite HT 400
  • 10:29 – Application benefits of Supoxy technology
  • 11:17 – A different way to think about being “greener” with coatings
  • 12:17 – Wrap up

item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss a topic that they have hinted at for 125 episodes. Paul and Jack give you the why behind the coating selection process as they explore an over-arching theme of the show in depth.

item.title: CTSP Episode 125 - Chris Tiernay on Carboline + COVID 19
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the end of the world...j/k
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carboline President Chris Tiernay to discuss Carboline and COVID 19. The trio discusses the current status of Carboline and of the things to come soon.

item.title: CTSP Episode 124 - Joe Walker, New dry film thickness measurement technology
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about advancement
item.description: Joe Walker (no relation), of Elcometer, stops by the Carboline booth at SSPC Coatings + to discuss advancements in dry film thickness measurement technology with Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis. The trio discusses scanning technology gauges and factory calibrated gauges.

item.title: CTSP Episode 123 - Adhesion values
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about minimums
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss adhesion values and what they mean. How do we get maximum adhesion and how low should be acceptable. Originally released 11/26/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 122 - All the zinc
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about zinc and it's uses
item.description: Bernardo Duran of the International Zinc Association stops by to discuss the use of zinc for corrosion control with Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis. The trio explores the different method zinc is deployed for corrosion control. Recorded live on 2/4/20 at Coatings + 2020.

item.title: CTSP Episode 121 - Crude Oil Storage Tanks
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a novolac
item.description: Kyle Smith stops by SSPC Coatings + to discuss the lining of crude oil storage tanks with Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis. They discuss the challenges and remedies for this challenging service. Recorded live at SSPC Coatings + on 2/5/20.

item.title: CTSP Episode 120 - New SSPC Concrete Standards
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about things with concrete
item.description: Dustin Young of SSPC joins Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis to discuss new concrete standards from SSPC. The trio discusses the new concrete abrasive blasting standards SSPC CAB 1-3. Also, they talk about the new surface texture standard for resinous flooring SSPC CTS-1.

item.title: CTSP Episode 119 - NACE & SSPC Merger Update
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about Bob and Bill
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by the Executive Director of NACE Bob Chalker and the Executive Director of SSPC Bill Worms to discuss the ongoing merger talks between NACE and SSPC. Listen as the two give a timely update and cover topics from board composition to standards. Recorded live in front of a studio audience at SSPC Coatings + on 2/6/20.

item.title: CTSP Episode 118 - Corrosion Cell Revisited
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the birth of Billum
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis drop in on Corrosion. They meet up with William, Bill, Will Seawell and discuss the corrosion cell and how it affects our industry. Original release 6/4/18

item.title: CTSP Episode 117 - Solvent and Water Based Intumescent Coatings
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about differences
item.description: Paul Atzemis and Jack Walker welcome Sean Younger back to the show. The trio discusses the differences between solvent and water-based intumescent coatings. They cover the advantages and disadvantages of both and the importance of being able to offer both solvent and water-based intumescent coatings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 116 - Surface Tolerant Coatings
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about Rerun.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis take a shot and talk about talk dirt. They discuss Surface Tolerant Coatings, their meanings, and when and where to apply them. They discuss surface cleanliness and its effects on coatings and how to manage expectations. Original release date 5/21/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 115 - The Carbozinc 11 Series
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about running on both legs
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their coverage of Inorganic Zinc and dive into the Carbozinc 11 series, specifically Carbozinc 11; Carbozinc 11 FC; and Carbozinc 11 HS. This is the second in the series of Zinc related topics. In this episode, they cover the performance properties and case histories of the Carbozinc 11 series of products. Originally published 3/5/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 114 - Inorganic Zinc Pt. 1
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about this one again
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis dive into the topic of Inorganic Zinc and the Carbozinc 11 series. This episode is the first in the series of Zinc related topics. In this episode, they present the overall background for the reasons and benefits of using Inorganic Zinc to prevent corrosion. Originally aired 2/26/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 113 - SFRM Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about specific materials
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have Sean Younger in the studio for Part 2 of the discussion of Carboline's SFRM materials, Southwest Type 5 and Type 7 lines. They expand on the difference between gypsum and Portland cement-based materials and when and where to use them. Original air date 3/26/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 112 - SFRM Again
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about spray-applied fireproofing
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have Sean Younger in the studio to discuss Carboline's SFRM materials. Learn about the difference between gypsum and portland cement-based materials. Original air-date 3/19/18.

item.title: CTSP Episode 111 - Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays
item.itunes:subtitle: Holiday special
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis with you Happy Holidays and Merry Christmas. The guys also get a new announcer.

item.title: CTSP Episode 110- Water Storage Tanks
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where they go up
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss water storage tanks. Listen as they cover corrosion causes and remedies of these structures.

item.title: CTSP Episode 109- Wastewater Treatment Pt. 6
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about one last shirty ride.
item.description: Paul Atzemis and Jack Walker finally put the wastewater treatment series behind them. They wrap up the series with a discussion about the coating concerns and solutions for ancillary plant areas. Paul and Jack also summarize the series until this point.

item.title: CTSP Episode 108 - Wastewater Treatment Pt. 5
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where they get shirty V
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their exploration of the water treatment process. They discuss the storage of chemicals onsite at water treatment plants. The two discuss typical coating solutions for the storage tank linings and surrounding secondary containment areas.

item.title: CTSP Episode 107 - Wastewater Treatment Pt. 4
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where they get shirty IV
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their look at the water treatment process and the coatings required for asset protection. This week Paul and Jack are joined by the Godfather himself, Anthony Grigsby. Anthony is an engineering sales rep for Carboline, who focuses on the water and wastewater markets.

item.title: CTSP Episode 106 - Wastewater Treatment Pt. 3
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where shirty rides again
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their exploration of the water treatment process. In this episode, they specifically look at the collection and transmission systems of the untreated wastewater. They discuss the proper coating systems for each system.

item.title: CTSP Episode 105 - Wastewater Treatment Pt. 2
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where they get shirty part deux
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis explore SSPC Technology Guide No. 27, thanks to the one and only Jim Kunkle. This guide explores the corrosive properties of the wastewater systems aimed specifically at concrete. Jack thinks he is funny, and Paul can't handle it.

item.title: CTSP Episode 104 - Wastewater Treatment Pt. 1
item.itunes:subtitle: The one where they get shirty
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis begin a series on coatings for wastewater treatment. In this first episode, Paul and Jack give an overview of the water treatment process. They also discuss another podcast milestone.

item.title: CTSP Episode 103 - Dissimilar Metals
item.itunes:subtitle: Heavy Metal discussion about metals that don't like each other... or maybe like each other too much.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk about differences in metals. They discuss the chemical process that happens with dissimilar metals.

item.title: CTSP Episode 102 - Competitive Crossovers
item.itunes:subtitle: Making the Change
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the process of making a competitive crossover for specifications. They talk about what is important to know and compare between products. Oh yeah, they are in a new studio with some great new options as well. Stay tuned for future experiments.

item.title: CTSP Episode 101 - Cold Weather Painting Tips
item.itunes:subtitle: Getting thick in the cold
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis start the second century with a discussion about cold weather painting. They discuss tips, tricks, and warnings about painting in the winter.

item.title: CTSP Episode 100 - Celebration Episode with many guests
item.itunes:subtitle: We did it!
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis hit the century mark with the CTSP! They are joined by several guests and play many of the congratulations messages from supporters. Jack and Paul want to give a big "Thank You" to all the fans and listeners.

item.title: CTSP Episode 099 - Testing, ASTM B117, Steve Liebhart
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a response
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis bring Carboline Testing Lab Manager Steve Liebhart, in to help the discussion about ASTM B117 and what it really means. The trio discuss the value of the test and how to apply it.

item.title: CTSP Episode 098 - Tank Lining Chemistry
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about getting deep.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Dr. Absolutely (listen for the bell) Chris Fenoli, PhD as they continue the discussion in the tank lining series. In this episode they discuss the chemistry of coatings and linings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 097 - Choosing a Tank Lining with Billum
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a question
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Technical Service Engineer and analytical chemist, William (Billum) Seawell as they begin the discussion of choosing a tank lining. In this episode they present the types of information required from the owner, specifier, or applicator prior to choosing the lining.

item.title: CTSP Episode 096 - Blast Media Summary
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about and ending
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis bring the blast media series to an end. The discuss the highlights of the last 7 episodes of the CTSP with some comparisons of when to choose each type of blast media.

item.title: CTSP Episode 095 - Sponge Jet, Ted Valoria
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being soft
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk with Ted Valoria of Spongejet. The guys have a great discussion about the benefits of sponge abrasive media.

item.title: CTSP Episode 094 - Abrasives Continued with Jake Wren of Surface Prep Supply
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about getting it dry
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis chat with Jake Wren, General Manager at Surface Prep Supply. They talk about what it takes to pick the right abrasives and some of the many options available at SPS.

item.title: CTSP Episode 093 - Near-White Metal vs White Metal Surface Prep review
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the job
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis re-evaluate the discussion from a previous episode about SSPC-SP5/NACE No 1 vs SSPC-SP10/NACE No 2. What is really possible vs. what is practical on a jobsite.

item.title: CTSP Episode 092 - Metallic Blast Media explained
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being dull
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the differences between shot and grit. They cover the when and why you would choose each and the pros and cons of each type.

item.title: CTSP Episode 091 - Abrasive Blasting Standards Review with Dan Baribault
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a throw back
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carboline Tech Service's own, Dan Baribault. The guys revisit a discussion about abrasive blast standards.

item.title: CTSP Episode 090 - Blasting Part 2, Cold Jet, Dry Ice Blasting
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about stripping...paint
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis move to Part 2 of their abrasive blast discussion. In this one, they talk with Cold Jet about dry ice blasting and equipment. Visit coldjet.com for additional information on dry ice blasting.

item.title: CTSP Episode 089 - Blast Media overview
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being gritty
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis dive into abrasive blast types and standards. They open up a multi-episode series to cover many of the options.

item.title: CTSP Episode 088 - Polyaspartic technology explained
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being hot and wet
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis get back to the mics and talk Polyaspartic technology. They discuss the benefits and difficulties of this type of coating and its typical uses.

item.title: CTSP Episode 087 - Cathodic Protection, Bass Engineering
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the current
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Jarret Brelsford of Bass Engineering to talk about Cathodic Protection. Bass Engineering designs and installs CP systems.

item.title: CTSP Episode 086 - Hy-Flex Fireproofing pumps
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the meats
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis meet with Allen Mills. Allen is the President of Hy-Flex Corporation. They work with industrial pumps, mixers, and spray equipment and have been a long time supporter for Carboline Fireproofing.

item.title: CTSP Episode 085 - Robots painting welds, Gus Garza, CRC-Evans
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about making it small
item.description:
Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis get to talk about Robots! The guys sit down with Gus Garza with CRC Evans Automatic Welding. They talk about the new developments in automation in coating, welding, and pipeline repair and installation.

Find out more at https://carboline-tech-service-podcast.pinecast.co

item.title: CTSP Episode 084 - International growth, Jim Kunkle, Juan Caballero, SSPC Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about getting to touch it.

Blues Win the Stanley Cup! (Sorry Scott) The wheels stay on the bus and Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are re-joined by a long time supporter and 2nd time guest, Jim Kunkle. Jim is the Business Development Manager for SSPC and specializes in Central and South America. With him, is Juan Caballero. Juan was recently elected to SSPC's Board of Governors as the International Representative.

Find out more at https://carboline-tech-service-podcast.pinecast.co

item.title: CTSP Episode 083 - Mike Tabb, Carboline Survey
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about peeking
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Mike Tabb. Mike leads Carboline's survey program. The trio talks about what it takes to perform a survey at a chemical facility and what benefits it will give to the owner and maintenance groups.

item.title: CTSP Episode 082 - NACE Education, Corrosion 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about learning
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk education with NACE. They interview Melanie Diaz (Sr Manager, Education Bus.Development) and Pam Nicoletti (Director of Education). The group talks about the current offerings and future options for NACE's educational opportunities.

item.title: CTSP Episode 081 - BYK Additives, Ronald Brashear, Coatings 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about spreading it around
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Ronald Brashear. Ron is the End Use Manager for Protective Coatings Additives in North America for BYK. The guys discuss the role of dispersing agents in coating formulation.

item.title: CTSP Episode 080 - Elcometer, Christopher Platt, Dry Film Thickness Testing
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being too early
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis bring in the JV support to answer a listener question. They are joined by Christopher Platt of Elcometer to discuss dry film thickness testing and how early is too early.

item.title: CTSP Episode 079 - MBX Bristle Blaster, Andy Steinmann, SSPC Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about peening
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk with Andy Steinmann from Corrosion Specialties. The guys got together at SSPC Coating+ 2019 to talk about surface prep and the MBX Bristle Blaster from Montipower.

item.title: CTSP Episode 078 - Jenna Hazelrigg, Headwall Photonics, Corrosion 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a vote
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis put in extra hours for this interview with Jenna Hazelrigg of Headwall Photonics. They discuss the future and current offerings of drones in the coatings industry. What they can do now and what is on the horizon. As a reminder, don't forget to vote for Dwayne Meyer for SSPC Board of Governors during the month of May 2019

item.title: CTSP Episode 077 - Graco, Corrosion 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a plan
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk plural spray equipment with Graco's Business Development Manager for PC equipment, Eric Rennerfeldt. The guys discuss spray equipment design and new offerings from Graco.

item.title: CTSP Episode 076 - BlastOne, Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about support
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis sit down with BlastOne at SSPC Coatings+. The guys talk with Graeme Thomas, Innovation and Technology Director and Brad Gooden, Vice President of BlastOne. The group discusses equipment, blasting, safety, training, and robots.

item.title: CTSP Episode 075 - Life Expectancy of Coatings, Corrosion 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about length
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss how long a coating system should last. They discuss the conditions that effect the service life of coatings and how to improve that life cycle.

item.title: CTSP Episode 074 - Bob Chalker (NACE) and Bill Worms (SSPC)
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the big announcement
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Bill Worms (Executive Director of SSPC) and Bob Chalker (CEO of NACE). The discussion centers around the big announcement of the investigation into synergistic opportunities in which the two organizations can work together or join efforts. They talk about what lies ahead for these two organizations.

item.title: CTSP Episode 073 - Bullard, safety, silica, Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about vision
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Wells Bullard, CEO of Bullard, and her team. The group discusses the history of Bullard, the invention of the modern hard hat, silica safety and much more. They also announce the first giveaway as part of the CTSP.

item.title: CTSP Episode 072 - Brion Palmer, PaintSquare, JPCL, Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about thumper
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their interviews at SSPC Coatings+ 2019. They are joined by the CEO of Technology Publishing Corporation Brion Palmer. Brion's company is the publishing company for JPCL, PaintSquare, PaintSquare Press, and Durability and Design to name a few.

item.title: CTSP Episode 071 - Michael Woodward, Reader's Choice Award, Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about recovering
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carboline's very own, award winning author, Michael Woodward. Michael's story about a bridge, "Troubled Bridge Over Salt Water," won the JPCL 2019 Reader's Choice award. Michael was presented with the award at the Coatings+ conference in an Awards Luncheon on Monday February 11, 2019.

item.title: CTSP Episode 070 - Holdtight, Ken Rossy, SSPC Coatings+
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being clean
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their coverage at SSPC Coatings+ 2019. They sit down with Ken Rossy, VP of Sales and Marketing for Holdtight. The guys talk about Holdtight, salt removal, and surface cleanliness.

item.title: CTSP Episode 069 - Elcometer, Michael Sellars, SSPC Coatings+
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about history
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis sit down with the Managing Director of Elcometer, Michael Sellars. The guys talk about the long history of Elcometer, their family tradition, Elcometer’s new products and where they are headed as a company.

item.title: CTSP Episode 068 - SSPC Coatings+, Nicole Lourette and Mike Kline
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a party
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are again at SSPC Coatings+. This time, they are joined by Nicole Lourette (Event Specialist) and Michael Kline (Director of Technology and Communications). The group discusses what it actually takes to put together an international conference like Coatings+.

item.title: CTSP Episode 067 - SSPC Coatings+, Bill Worms
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the boss
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are recording live at SSPC Coatings+ at Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida. They are privileged to be joined by the Executive Director of SSPC, Bill Worms.

item.title: CTSP Episode 066 - Tim Holmes, Disney, SSPC, and Thick Film DTM Urethane
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a glove
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis go LIVE at SSPC Coatings+ 2019 at Walt Disney World. The guys kick off the event with one of Carboline's own sales representatives, Tim Holmes from Birmingham, AL. They talk about the importance and uses of direct to metal urethanes.

item.title: CTSP Episode 065 - SSPC Coatings+ 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a #
item.description: Jack Waler and Paul Atzemis get ready for SSPC Coatings+ 2019 and their onsite schedule. They finalize the announcement of what is happening at the conference, where they will be, when they will be there, and how to get in contact with them. #podcast #SSPC2019 #carboline #questions

item.title: CTSP Episode 064 - Airless Pump Basics with Dan Baribault
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the push
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis bring fellow Tech Service Engineer and "pump whisperer" Dan Baribault to discuss Industrial Airless Spray Equipment. The trio discuss the basics of pump selection how sizes are made and chosen.

item.title: CTSP Episode 063 - John Myers, Rail Car Linings in PaintSquare.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about purity
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Carboline's Technical Sales Manager for Rail in the Southeast, John Myers. John wrote an article for JPCL and PaintSquare.com about a baked phenolic tank lining used for hauling Phenol for over 24 years and shows no signs of stopping.

item.title: CTSP Episode 062 - Rebar, Zinc, and Concrete
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a bridge
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss ASTM A775. The discuss the benefits and concerns of using Inorganic Zinc on steel that will be buried in concrete. They discuss the systems used for coating Rebar.

item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the rub
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the details of ASTM D5402, Solvent Rub test for organic coatings. They cover the how and why you need to know this standard.

item.title: CTSP Episode 060 - Isocyanate Technology and moisture
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a crystal
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by recurring guest, William (Billum) Seawell. The guys discuss the common problems found when urethane technology and isocyanates are exposed to moisture.

item.title: CTSP Episode 059 - Stripe Coating
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the process
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the purpose and process of Stripe Coating. What is it for and should you do it?

item.title: CTSP Episode 058 - Merry Christmas and Happy Holiday
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about going home

item.title: CTSP Episode 057 - Euclid Chemical, Aimee Pergalsky
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about getting dry
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis meet with Aimee Pergalsky, Central Region Business Development Manager for Euclid Chemical. The group discusses who Euclid Chemical is and what they do. They discuss the relationship of Euclid Chemical and Carboline, both RPM companies.

item.title: CTSP Episode 056 - Jim Rippe, Charity, and Fireproofing discussions
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a cannon
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have a discussion with the Executive Vice President of Fireproofing and Engineered Sales, Jim Rippe. The three discuss the CarboCare charity event of donating toys to Cardinal Glennon Children's Hospital in St. Louis. The have an adventure picking the next topic and discuss Carboline's soon to open new Fireproofing Testing lab.

item.title: CTSP Episode 055 - Live Part Deux now with Jeff Anderson of Carboline RD&I
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a sound
item.description: Happy Birthday CTSP- Part Deux! In this birthday celebration followup, Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis record in front of a live audience with Jeff Anderson, Vice President of Research, Development, and Innovation for Carboline. The trio talk about what it takes to bring products to market.

item.title: CTSP Episode 054 - Adhesion Value discussion
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being too low
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss adhesion values and what they mean. How do we get maximum adhesion and how low should be acceptable.

item.title: CTSP Episode 053 - Chris Tiernay and Birthday Celebration
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about why
item.description: Happy Birthday CTSP Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carobline's president, Chris Tiernay, for a special live recording of the podcast. The three guys talk about Carboline's "why" and how the podcast came into existence. Thanks for a great first year!

item.title: CTSP Episode 052 - Near-White vs White Metal cleanliness
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being visual
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss and debate the ability to achieve SSPC-SP10/NACE 2 vs SSPC-SP5/NACE 1 when performing surface prep. They debate the visual standard (VIS 1) vs the written standard and they pass around a few "Thank You's" in their final episode of the first season of the Carboline Tech Service Podcast.

item.title: CTSP Episode 051 - Color, is it really there?
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a tree in the forest
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined once again with Carboline's Color Lab Manager, Kate Rogers. Kate discuss color with the guys. They talk about what is needed to see it and how it can change.

item.itunes:subtitle: The one about turning yellow

item.itunes:subtitle: The one about keeping it clean

item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Ronald Brashear. Ron is the End Use Manager for Protective Coatings Additives in North America for BYK. The 3 discuss the important role BYK plays in coating formulation and how BYK can help.

item.title: CTSP Episode 047 - FDA and Force curing coatings

The group discusses the reasons for baking or force curing needed for linings in direct contact with food. They discuss the FDA, 21CFR 175.300, and most importantly Taste and Odor.

item.title: CTSP Episode 046 - Hydrostatic Pressure
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about pressure

item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being all wet
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the joint SSPC/NACE Water Jet standards WJ-1, WJ-2, WJ-3, WJ-4. They are joined by Carboline Tech Service Engineer Dan Baribault.

item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being tied
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss acrylic resins and what they are used for and how they are blended to modify coating properties.

item.title: CTSP Episode 043 - Alkyd Resins, Coating Selection Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a nerd
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis talk about Alkyd resins, where they come from, and where they are now. They talk about uses, problems and benefits of alkyds.

item.title: CTSP Episode 041 - SSPC-SP13/NACE No. 6 Surface Prep of Concrete update
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about new rocks

item.title: CTSP Episode 039 - Insulative Coatings with Steve Harrison
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about little green men
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carboline's legendary Steve Harrison. The trio has a hot conversation about insulation. They discuss the properties and performance of Carbotherm 551 and Carbotherm 3300.

item.title: CTSP Episode 038 - SPC, Matt Alliston
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being way up North
item.description: In this episode, Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview Matt Alliston, the VP of the SPC division of Carboline. They talk history, pipelines, coatings, and surface prep.

item.title: CTSP Episode 037- Urethane Cement
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about driving
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the merits of using urethane cements for a flooring job. They also discuss the differences between the new Carbocrete flooring products.

item.title: CTSP Episode 036 - Polymer Concrete, Semstone 300, 305, 884
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about selling time in a red bucket.
item.description: In this episode, Jack and Paul talk about the Hidden Gems in the Carboline Semstone line of Polymer Concretes. Semstone 300, Semstone 305 and Semstone 884 are discussed with some helpful information about when and where these products should be used.

item.title: CTSP Episode 035- TruQC with Megan Brinker
item.itunes:subtitle: The One about Birthdays
item.description: The COO of TruQC Megan Brinker stops by to how TruQC can help report, track and analyze everything you need for compliance in a convenient mobile application. Paul, Jack and Megan also discuss advancements in technology that can be utilized on your industrial coatings project.

item.title: CTSP Episode 034- Dry Abrasive Blast Standards Part 2 with Dan Baribault
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about including residue
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by one of Carboline’s Senior Technical Service Engineers, Dan Baribault. Joint them as they discuss Part 2 of the SSPC standards of Hand Tool and Power Tool surface preparation of steel.

item.title: CTSP Episode 033- Dry Abrasive Blast Standards, Part 1 with Dan Baribault
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being clean
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by one of Carboline’s Senior Technical Service Engineers, Dan Baribault. Joint them as they discuss the joint NACE and SSPC standards of Dry Abrasive Blasting, surface preparation of steel.

item.title: CTSP Episode 032- Soluble Salts, Chlor-Rid
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about being salty
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined in studio by Norman Petticrew of the Chlor-rid division of Borchers and Joe Harris of Borchers. The group talks about salts and debut a new segment...

item.title: CTSP Episode 031-Value Engineering
item.itunes:subtitle: The One about Paint
item.description: Paul and Jack discuss what is actually in a gallon of paint. Why solids by volume is important when making a coating selection.

item.title: CTSP Episode 030- Topcoating Inorganic Zinc
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a message
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the common difficulties and problems with applying coatings over Inorganic Zinc Primers.

item.title: CTSP Episode 029- The Corrosion Cell
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a drop
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis drop in on Corrosion. They meet up with William, Bill, Will Seawell and discuss the corrosion cell and how it effects our industry.

item.title: CTSP Episode 028- Federal Standards
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the pipe
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis make a stand with standards. They talk about Food Grade coatings and water system linings. Tune in to hear a summary of the differences between FDA, USDA, NSF/ANSI 61, AWWA C210 and D102.

item.title: CTSP Episode 027- Surface Tolerant Coatings
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about dirt
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis take a shot and talk about talk dirt. They discuss Surface Tolerant Coatings, their meanings, and when and where to apply them. They discuss surface cleanliness and its effects on coatings and how to manage expectations.

item.title: CTSP Episode 026- Firestopping Part 3, The Final Chapter with Paul Gauci and Ron Van Frankfoort
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a hole in the wall.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis enter the final chapter with Ron Van Frankfoort and Paul Gauci as they discuss Firestopping. In this episode they complete the topic with a discussion about the supporting products for the firestopping market.

item.title: CTSP Episode 025- Firestopping Part 2 with Paul Gauci and Ron Van Frankfoort
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a curtain
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis dive back in with Fireproofing. Now for Part 2 of their discussion with Ron Van Frankfoort and Paul Gauci as they discuss Firestopping. In this discussion they deal with applications and uses for Firestopping.

item.title: CTSP Episode 024- Firestopping with Ron Van Frankfoort and Paul Gauci
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a block
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis dive back in with Fireproofing. Listen in to Part 1 of their discussion with Ron Van Frankfoort and Paul Gauci as they discuss Firestopping. In this discussion, they touch on standards, testing and definitions.

item.title: CTSP Episode 023- Coatings Under Insulation, NACE SP0198, CUI
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a near miss
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue the discussion of Corrosion Under Insulation (CUI) with an in-depth explanation of the NACE SP0198 categories and the appropriate coatings for each. Make sure to listen to the end for the special caller they get a message from about last weeks episode.

item.title: CTSP Episode 022- Corrosion Under Insulation (CUI) and NACE SP0198
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about...Look Out!
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have target practice to discuss Corrosion Under Insulation (CUI) and NACE SP0-198.

item.title: CTSP Episode 021- On location with Fire Testing
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a burn
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis join Carboline Fireproofing Chemist, Brooke Grau in the Fire Test Lab. Listen as they follow Brooke around for a Q & A about how a fire test is performed.

item.title: CTSP Episode 020- SSPC, James Kunkle interview
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about defense
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by SSPC’s very own Jim Kunkle. The three beards discuss current and future happenings at SSPC and opportunities available from SSPC.

item.title: CTSP Episode 019- SFRM Part 2 Southwest Type 5 and 7
item.itunes:subtitle: primer.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have Sean Younger in the studio for Part 2 of the discussion of Carboline's SFRM materials, Southwest Type 5 and Type 7 lines. They expand on the difference between gypsum and Portland cement-based materials and when and where to use them.

item.title: CTSP Episode 018- SFRMs Pt. 1
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the missing a
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis have Sean Younger in the studio to discuss Carboline's SFRM materials. Learn about the difference between gypsum and portland cement based materials.

item.title: CTSP Episode 017- SSPC-SP13/NACE No. 6 Surface Prep of Concrete
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about rocks
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis hit the concrete. In this episode, they discuss the details of SSPC-SP13/NACE No. 6 The Surface Prep of Concrete. They discuss the importance of moisture tests and the curing of concrete prior to painting.

item.title: CTSP Episode 016- Inorganic Zinc Part 2, Carbozinc 11 series
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a blast off.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis continue their coverage of Inorganic Zinc and dive into the Carbozinc 11 series, specifically Carbozinc 11; Carbozinc 11 FC; and Carbozinc 11 HS. This is the second in the series of Zinc related topics. In this episode they cover the performance properties and case histories of the Carbozinc 11 series of products.

item.title: CTSP Episode 015- Inorganic Zinc, Carbozinc 11 series Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about heavy metal
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis dive into the topic of Inorganic Zinc and the Carbozinc 11 series. This is the first in the series of Zinc related topics. In this episode they present the overall background for the reasons and benefits of using Inorganic Zinc to prevent corrosion.

item.title: CTSP Episode 014- Tank Lining Series, Part 4
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about drawing conclusions
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis conclude this 4-part series on Tank Linings. They summarize the previous 3 episodes covering what information is needed to make an accurate tank lining recommendation, the chemistry of tank linings, and the common failures seen in tank linings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 013- Tank Lining Series, Part 3 Lining Failures
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about blisters
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss lining failures in this Part 3 of their 4 part series on Tank Linings. They take an in depth look at Osmotic Blisters and Cold Wall effect. They are also joined by 2 very special guests to help introduce the podcast.

item.title: CTSP Episode 012- Tank Lining Series, Part 2 Chemistry
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about chemistry
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Dr. Absolutely (listen for the bell) Chris Fenoli, PhD as they continue the discussion in the tank lining series. This is the second episode in the series of what goes into choosing a tank lining. In this episode they discuss the chemistry of coatings and linings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 011- Tank Lining Series, Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about so many questions
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Technical Service Engineer and analytical chemist, William Seawell as they begin the discussion of choosing a tank lining. This is the first in the series of what goes into choosing a tank lining. In this episode they present the types of information required from the owner, specifier, or applicator prior to choosing the lining.

item.title: CTSP Episode 010- Sanitile 755FR Application
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about surviving application.
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are again joined by Chris Fenoli, PhD. This time, they venture into Carboline’s Research, Development & Innovation (RD&I) Center for an application test and demo of the new Sanitile 755 FR.

item.title: CTSP Episode 009- Weathering Finishes, Mary Roley, SSPC Award
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the weather
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Mary Roley, Technical Director for R&D at Carboline. The discussion centers around the technology and testing of weathering finishes. The trio round out the conversation with a nod to the SSPC Women in Coatings Impact Award winner for 2018, Carboline’s own Mary Roley. Congratulations Mary!

item.title: CTSP Episode 008- Thermosorb Intumescent Coatings
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about fire
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss Carboline's Intumescent Coatings, Thermo-Sorb E, VOC, and 263 with Sean Younger.

item.title: CTSP Episode 007- SSPC-PA2, Carbocoat 8225
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about thickness
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis interview a special guest about the details of SSPC-PA2. They then discuss the properties of Carboline's newest alkyd coating, Carbocoat 8225.

item.title: CTSP Episode 006- Christmas Special
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about the holidays
item.description: Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays for Jack Walker, Paul Atzemis and Carboline Tech Service! Thanks for supporting us.

item.title: CTSP Episode 005- Dew Point, TAM, Tricia O'Brien
item.itunes:subtitle: The One About Managing Moisture
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss dew point calculation as it relates to coating application. Then they talk with Carboline Communications Manager, Tricia O'Brien, about Total Asset Management- aka TAM.

item.title: CTSP Episode 004- Carbozinc 608 HB, & Overnight Night Low Temp Cure
item.itunes:subtitle: The One about the Changing of the Season
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss Carboline's brand new innovative product Carbozinc 608 HB. Jack and Paul also answer a caller's question about dropping temps overnight and the effect on the curing process of coatings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 003- Carbothane 8845, Pump Rental, Abrasion Testing
item.itunes:subtitle: The One About Becoming Official
item.description: In Episode 3, Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by Carboline Chemist Erik Humbert to talk about Carbothane 8845. Then they are joined by Ryan Zabel to talk about the Carboline Pump Rental program. This episode ends with a discusion about Tabor Abrsion testing in ASTM D4060.

item.title: CTSP Episode 002- Sanitile 755FR, Kate Rogers, Color, and Coating Thickness
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about survival, relaunched
item.description: Jack and Paul are joined by Chris Fenoli, PhD to discuss Carboline’s newly released: Sanitile 755 FR. Kate Rogers stops by to discuss Carboline’s color lab and its capabilities. Paul and Jack then discuss the possible procedures to correct excessive coating thickness.

item.title: CTSP Episode 001- Carbomastic 94, Job Site Sampling, & Adhesion Testing
item.itunes:subtitle: The One about Creation
item.description: Paul Atzemis and Jack Walker discuss the many attributes of Carbomastic 94. They interview William Seawell to discuss proper jobsite sampling. Paul and Jack also discuss the differences in adhesion testing standards.

item.title: CTSP Episode 000 - An Introduction to the Carboline Tech Service Podcast
item.itunes:subtitle: The one about a hitchhiker's guide
item.description:
Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis introduce listeners to the Carboline Tech Service Podcast. They offer a roadmap for exploration into the show.

Subscribe via iTunes, Google Play, or Spotify.

Find out more at https://carboline-tech-service-podcast.pinecast.co
